messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Pensacola
messages.msgSnippet: I just decided I m coming to Pensacola.  Last night I thought I might try Peabody this year, but I just can t swing it.  I want to plan to stay at least a
messages.messageBody:
I just decided I'm coming to Pensacola. Last night I thought I might
try Peabody this year, but I just can't swing it. I want to plan to
stay at least a week, and I can't afford a week in Boston!

Ren-are you going to start a discussion list for the 05 conference? Or
will the 04 list just become the 05 list when Peabody is over?

Jenny

<<So, be honest with us Ren -- how big are the mosquitoes in Pensacola?
>>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 98
messages.msgSnippet: So, be honest with us Ren -- how big are the mosquitoes in Pensacola?  Are they as plentiful as in, say, DC or Hilo, Hawaii? I ve been trying to talk Gary into
messages.messageBody:
So, be honest with us Ren -- how big are the mosquitoes in Pensacola? Are they as plentiful as in, say, DC or Hilo, Hawaii?

I've been trying to talk Gary into the 05 conference, but the bugs, heat and humidity (even in October) make it a really hard sell. Especially when he factors how yummy it is here (Albq) in October. How do I sell Pensacola to a guy who hates humidity?

Syl


~~waving my hands in Pensacola~~

White sand, turquoise water, balmy weather and no crowds...sounds like a good place for a bunch of nefarious UNSCHOOLERS!!:)

Ren
